intro: Aristolochia meionantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Dutchman's pipe, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its striking, tubular, maroon-colored flowers that resemble a pipe, hence its common name. The plant has heart-shaped, dark green leaves with a velvety texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. The genus Aristolochia is known for its complex chemical compounds, some of which have medicinal uses but can also be toxic.
